page.title: 02Saint Mary's church Polstead
page.content: The church of Saint Mary stands near to the remains of the Gospel Oak, probably a site of pre-Christian worship.The church dates from 1160 and has a well preserved Norman west doorway and clerestory windows and arches . The church is built of ragstone and flint with Roman brick and tile.The Norman brick arches inside the church are an unusual feature,the bricks are almost certainly Norman and made not far from the church,In the 14th century the chancel was enlarged and a tower with a spire added. The spire is the only old stone spire in Suffolk.Larger decorated windows were put in.In the churchyard a small wooden cross marks the grave of the unfortunate Maria Marten.The original gravestone has been chipped away by souvenir hunters.
